skill.author: Claude Flow Team

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. Contains only markdown documentation describing CLI commands and usage examples for the Claude Flow performance analysis capability.

content.value_statement: Claude Flow swarms can suffer from performance issues affecting speed and efficiency. This skill detects bottlenecks, generates detailed reports, and provides actionable optimization recommendations to improve swarm performance.
actual_capabilities: Detect performance bottlenecks across communication, processing, memory, and network layers
Generate comprehensive performance reports in JSON, HTML, or Markdown formats
Analyze agent utilization, task completion times, and coordination overhead
Provide AI-powered optimization recommendations with estimated improvement percentages
Apply automatic optimizations with --fix flag for common issues
Compare current performance with historical data to track improvements
limitations: Requires Claude Flow to be installed and configured for full functionality
Does not modify source code directly; only provides recommendations
Cannot diagnose issues outside of Claude Flow swarm operations
Performance metrics depend on proper logging and monitoring setup

best_practices: Run bottleneck detection after major changes to identify performance regressions
Set appropriate thresholds: 10-15% for production, 25-30% for development environments
Review recommendations before applying --fix to understand the changes being made
anti_patterns: Running with default threshold without considering your specific performance requirements
Ignoring warning-level bottlenecks that can escalate to critical issues over time

faq.question: Which Claude tools are supported?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Full functionality requires Claude Flow installed locally.

faq.question: What performance metrics are analyzed?
faq.answer: Communication delays, task completion times, agent utilization, cache hit rates, memory access patterns, and network latency.

faq.question: Can this skill modify my code?
faq.answer: No. The skill only analyzes performance and provides recommendations. The --fix flag adjusts swarm configuration, not source code.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. All analysis runs locally using your Claude Flow metrics. No data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: Why are no bottlenecks detected?
faq.answer: Check that Claude Flow logging is enabled and metrics are being recorded. Ensure sufficient historical data exists for analysis.

faq.question: How does this compare to other monitoring tools?
faq.answer: This skill is specialized for Claude Flow swarms with AI-powered recommendations. Use general tools for system-level monitoring.
